Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant with plenty of water and light, showing healthy growth.
The student can draw a plant without water, showing wilted or unhealthy characteristics.
The student can draw a plant without light, indicating it is not growing well or is discolored.
The student can include labels or symbols to indicate where water or light is present or absent in the drawings.
The student can use the drawings to describe how plants need water and light to live and grow.
